ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: Learned how to write the first half of my thesis and got insight on my research question and methods which was very helpful.
In this course, I was able to properly lay out my thesis with the help of my professor and my classmates. Having deadlines was helpful to be able to get in the process of getting my work together.
Learning how to conduct your own independent research.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: Can't really say because not everyone has the same thesis topic. It is very much driven by the questions students have and where they are in their thesis-process.
Clarity in what days we didnt have class and did have class
A little more structure could be nice, but I also appreciate the flexibility. Sometimes going to physical class felt like a waste, but its nice to hear about other peoples research.

This course had a lot of organizational issues that I feel could be improved with a bit more thought and effort on the instructor's end. The majority of our time in class felt like it was not thought out and led to less than productive activities. Despite having such a small cohort of students, there was no effort to create a sense of community and collaboration. The only time we did peer-feedback was in class which led to a very short period of time to read and then discuss each other's drafts. If partners had been assigned in advance and we had been able to read the drafts before class, the class period would have been way more productive. The feedback we got was minimal and not very helpful. As it stands, the class just seems like a mandatory superficial check-in without any substantial feedback or improvement.
More peer review, could be better if class was just scheduled 1:1 meetings with the TF. Assignments could also be more clear.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: It's mandatory, not much of a choice

Yes; if youre a sociology major choosing between non intensive and intensive, definitely give intensive a shot because its nice to have the choice to research and add to a field youre really passionate about.
